basics.name: Frank Panton
basics.label: Engineering Design Graduate
basics.summary: A highly motivated Engineering Design graduate with experience across data analysis, energy systems modelling, automation, and business development. Passionate about sustainability and applying innovation to real-world challenges.

work.name: Whistler Blackcomb / Can-Ski
work.summary: Delivered ski and snowboard servicing, equipment fitting, and customer support in a high-volume resort environment.
highlights: Ensured safety and performance through technical equipment servicing.
Advised guests on ski and snowboard equipment suited to ability and conditions.
Gained customer service and teamwork experience in an international staff community.

work.name: Weightless
work.summary: Founded a health-tech spinoff developing a novel health monitoring solution for people with disabilities.
highlights: Secured £3,000 in grant funding for prototype development.
Authored and presented successful business proposal.
Designed and built first physical prototype under budget.

work.name: Everoze / University of Bristol
work.summary: Researched agrivoltaics systems combining solar and agricultural yields.
highlights: Built a first-principles digital twin of agrivoltaic systems.
Modelled solar and agricultural yields to optimise site design.
Conducted feasibility and financial analysis proving viability within 5 years.

work.name: Kwik-Step
work.summary: Developed disaster relief shelter concepts for humanitarian applications.
highlights: Directed technical development of a deployable shelter.
Ensured compliance with regulatory standards for commercialisation.

work.name: Arrival
work.summary: 12-month rotational placement across R&D teams in electric vehicle manufacturing.
highlights: Managed assembly of robotic end-effectors for composite ply placement, delivered ahead of schedule.
Designed and implemented hydraulic and electrical test rig for battery cooling plates.
Supported process automation and optimisation, reducing cost and lead times.
Conducted material characterisation experiments for production readiness.

work.name: Various Roles
work.summary: Held various part-time and seasonal roles in retail, pubs, and hospitality across the UK, Canada, and Latin America.
highlights: Built strong interpersonal and customer service skills.
Adapted to diverse, fast-paced working environments.
Self-funded extensive international travel through employment.

volunteer.summary: Weekly volunteer supporting community food distribution.
Led an outreach initiative based on the UN Sustainable Development Goals, guiding students in creating community projects.
Coordinated Bristol University’s 2020 Movember campaign, raising £54,000 for men’s health.
